intro: Linosyris graveolens, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is known for its strong, unpleasant odor. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture. Linosyris graveolens is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in dry, sunny environments.
